p: Back again, and almost used to being here! Nice, easy trip, and no one got tired; but the place seemed a bit lonely after being with you'ns. I did 12 lines today - nothing possible mondays.
George is getting burly. He is now determined to run in 1944. Says a lot about the paramount issue of world peace.
it was really a pleasure to be with you two again. I mean really, not just taffy.
Ollie, am I right in feeling that you'd like to have the motor and line shaft? If you

really want a little power shop in the basement, I'll have the stuff ready to bring on the next trip. Maybe in some second0hand store you can find a grinding head for two stones, with a V-belt pulley in the middle. The grinding head shaft ought to be 3/4" in diameter, tapered 5/8" wheel hole. I saw one in St. Louis somewhere, but didn't price it. Should be cheap or no buy.
I'm sending for a little diamond dust to re-charge my drills. Have several jobs I must do this winter.
Little to say, as you see. But we love you. George says when he's president he won't enforce his law in the case of old friends, meow!
